The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a distinctive blue-green coloration. Oriastrum pusillum is an important plant in its native habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife species.
